SEARCH
Package model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
model.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AIPlayer, Human
public abstract class Player extends Object implements Serializable
Abstract base class representing a player in the Gomoku game.

Each player has a name, a color (0 = White, 1 = Black), and a number of pieces they can place on the board. This class defines the common behaviors for all types of players (e.g., human or AI) and must be extended by concrete subclasses.

Since:
2025-03-26

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, int playerColor)
      Constructs a player with a given name and color. Assigns 60 pieces by default.
      Parameters:
      name - the player's name
      playerColor - 0 for white, 1 for black
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if playerColor is not 0 or 1

    • Player

      public Player(String name, int playerColor, int pieceNum)
      Constructs a player with custom piece count.
      Parameters:
      name - the player's name
      playerColor - 0 for white, 1 for black
      pieceNum - the number of pieces to start with

  • Method Details

    • newGame

      public void newGame(int startNumPieces)
      Resets the number of pieces for a new game.
      Parameters:
      startNumPieces - the number of pieces to assign at the start

    • play

      public void play(Grid grid, int row, int col)
      Plays a piece at the specified location on the grid. Decreases the player's remaining piece count by 1.
      Parameters:
      grid - the game grid
      row - the row index to place the piece
      col - the column index to place the piece
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the player has no pieces left

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon(Grid grid, int row, int col, int allignmentNum)
      Checks if the player has won the game by placing a piece at the given location.
      Parameters:
      grid - the game grid
      row - the row index of the last placed piece
      col - the column index of the last placed piece
      allignmentNum - number of pieces required to win (typically 5)
      Returns:
      true if the player has achieved the winning condition, false otherwise

    • choosePieceLocation

      public abstract int[] choosePieceLocation(Grid grid)
      Abstract method for selecting the piece location to play. This method must be implemented by subclasses (e.g., HumanPlayer, AIPlayer).
      Parameters:
      grid - the game grid
      Returns:
      an array of two integers representing row and column indices

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the player.

      Returns:
      number of pieces left

    • setPieceNum

      public void setPieceNum(int pieceNum)
      Sets the number of pieces the player has left.
      Parameters:
      pieceNum - the new number of pieces left

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the player. Includes player name, colour, and number of pieces remaining.
      Overrides:

      Returns:
      a formatted string describing the player
